events.title: Washington Crosses the Delaware River
events.description: General George Washington led Continental Army troops across the ice-filled Delaware River on Christmas night to launch a surprise attack against Hessian forces in Trenton, New Jersey.
events.significance: This daring maneuver resulted in a pivotal victory for the Continental Army, boosting morale during the American Revolutionary War.

events.title: Indian Ocean Earthquake and Tsunami
events.description: A massive undersea earthquake off the coast of Sumatra, Indonesia, triggered a devastating tsunami that affected countries bordering the Indian Ocean.
events.significance: One of the deadliest natural disasters in recorded history, it caused over 230,000 deaths and widespread destruction across multiple countries.

events.title: Riots across Korea during the Korean War
events.description: UN forces advanced across the 38th parallel during the Korean War, leading to intense fighting and shifting control between North and South Korea.
events.significance: The movements on this date marked significant phases in the Korean War, affecting international relations during the Cold War era.

events.title: Completion of the San Francisco Earthquake Relief Efforts
events.description: Relief and recovery efforts were ongoing following the devastating 1906 San Francisco earthquake earlier in April.
events.significance: Marked a turning point in urban planning and disaster preparedness in the United States.
